div.p: Greetings. Yesterday, I received letters from our Augsburg friend Hoser along with a booklet by Brenz, delivered by Leonard Schnider, who is now also from Augsburg and, if I am not mistaken, has also set out for Zürich. However, after his departure, when I was unpacking the bundle, I found this letter addressed to you, and I was angry with myself for not having opened everything before the messenger left. But what is done cannot be undone, although it is fortunate that I still find the people from Zürich, who adorned the wedding here three days ago with their presence, now departing, through whom I have taken care to have these letters delivered to you.
I would have sent along Brenz's booklet, if Hoser had not written that a copy was sent to you by Mr. Engelbert.
Farewell, my most esteemed and best brother in the Lord. Commend us diligently to the Lord. March 12.
To the most illustrious Mr. Heinrich Bullinger, his esteemed and very dear brother. In Zürich.
